00020 bool SocketConnection::connect() {
00021 
00022     if (SDLNet_ResolveHost(&address, host.c_str(), 80) == -1) {
00023         Error::error("SDLNet_Init: %s\n", SDLNet_GetError());
00024     }
00025 
00026     connection = SDLNet_TCP_Open(&address);
00027     if(!connection) {
00028         Error::error("SDLNet_TCP_Open: %s\n", SDLNet_GetError());
00029         return false;
00030     }
00031     connected = true;
00032     return true;
00033 }

00040 std::string SocketConnection::lastError() {
00041     if (errors.size()) {
00042         return errors[errors.size() - 1];
00043     }
00044     return "";
00045 }
00046 
00052 void SocketConnection::addError(std::string errorString) {
00053     errors.push_back(errorString);
00054 }
00061 bool SocketConnection::write(std::string toWrite) {
00062     if (!connected) {
00063         if (!connect()) {
00064             return false;
00065         }
00066     }
00067 
00068     int result = SDLNet_TCP_Send(connection, toWrite.c_str(), toWrite.size() + 1);
00069     if(result < (toWrite.size() + 1)) {
00070         printf("SDLNet_TCP_Send: %s\n", SDLNet_GetError());
00071         // It may be good to disconnect sock because it is likely invalid now.
00072     }
00073 
00074     return true;
00075 }
00076 
00083 std::string SocketConnection::read(int length) {
00084     if (!connected) {
00085         if (!connect()) {
00086             return false;
00087         }
00088     }
00089 
00090     char stringback[1024];
00091     int result = SDLNet_TCP_Recv(connection,stringback,length);
00092     if (result <= 0) {
00093         // An error may have occured, but sometimes you can just ignore it
00094         // It may be good to disconnect sock because it is likely invalid now.
00095     }
00096 
00097     return stringback;
00098 }

00107 bool SocketConnection::disconnect() {
00108     SDLNet_TCP_Close(connection);
00109     return true;
00110 }
